bibl.title: Sacred Stories of the Sweet Grass Cree
bibl.series: National Museum of Canada, Bulletin no. 60, Anthropological Series, no. 11

encodingdesc.p: This electronic document is oriented more toward representing those features that seem most likely to be relevant for grammatical analyses, rather than toward faithfully representing all the information available in the book.

list.item: 2014 06 10; KR; UTF-8, paragraph and sentence numbering, smart-quotes in English translations

p.seg: kîtahtawê pêyak kisêyiniw , êkwah pêyak nôtokêsiw , êkwah nîs ôskinîkiskwêwak otawâsimisiwâwa awa kisêyiniw . Once upon a time there was an old man, and an old woman, and two young women, the children of that old man and his wife.
kîtahtawê âhkosiw awa kisêyiniw ; piyis nipiw . Then at one time the old man feel sick; at last he died.
êkwah awa piko nôtokêsiw , êkwah otânisah nîso , nistowak . Then there were only three of them, the old woman and her two daughters.
êkotah ay-ayâwak . They stayed in the same place.
piyisk kinwês ayâwak . They dwelt there, in the end, for a long time.
kîtahtawê mina âhkosiw awa nôtokêsiw ; piyisk kinwês âhkosiw . Then, in time, the old woman, too, fell ill; in the end, she was sick a long while.
êkwah wîh-nipiw . Then she was about to die.

ômis îtwêw :
nitawâsimisitik , sipwêhtêhkêk ; She spoke thus: “My children, go away from here;

seg.gloss: try to find some people.

p.seg: kîspin miskawâyêko nâpêw , onâpêmihkêk , itêw ; If you find a man, marry him,” she told them;

seg.gloss: “Perhaps in this way you will not starve to death.”

p.seg: êhag , itwêwak ôk ôskinîkiskwêwak . “Yes,” said the young women.
êkosi kiyipah namoya pimâtisiw awa nôtokêsiw . Thereupon soon the old woman lived no more.

êkwah oskinîkiskwêwak ômis îtwêwak :
ômisi kkîh-itikonaw kikâwiyinaw :
sipwêhtêhkêk , nipiyâni , kîh-itwêw kikâwiyinaw , itwêw aw ômisimâw . then the young women spoke thus: “Our mother said this to us: ‘Go away from here when I die,’ said our mother,” spoke the elder sister.
tâpwê wâpahki ka-sipwêhtânânaw , itwêwak . “And so tomorrow we shall go,” they said.
tâpwê êh-wâpaniyik , sipwêhtêwak . Accordingly, on the morrow they set out.
kahkiyaw nakatamwak ocayânisiwâwa . They left behind all their possessions.
piyisk nîswâw êh-nipâcik , sîpiy otihtamwak . At last, when they had slept twice on the way, they came to a river.
mînisah mihcêtiniyiwa . There were many berries.
kwah nôhtêhkatêwak . And they were hungry.
êkotah mînisah mawisôwak , êwakoni êh-mîcicik . There they gathered berries and ate them.

ômis îtwêw aw ômisimâw :
hâw , nisîmis , êkâ wiya sipwêhtêtân . Thus spoke the dler sister: “Now, sister, let us not go away from here.
êwakonih kâ-mâh-mîciyahk mînisah nakatamahko , ka-nôhtêhkatânânaw , itêw osîmisah . If we leave these berries which we are eating, we shall starve,” she said to her younger sister.
tâpwê êkotah ayâwak . Accordingly, they stayed there.
niyôhtêyâpakwêtwâwi , itohtêwak nipîhk , sîpîhk êh-minihkwêcik . Whenever they were thirsty, they went to the water and drank from the stream.
piyisk kinwêsk êkotah ayâwak . In the end they stayed there a long time.

kîtahtawê kinwêsk êkot êh-ayâcik , êh-ntawi-minihkwêcik sîpîhk , kontah mêtawêwak êkotah , asinîsah êh-pâh-pakastawêwêpinâcik , kontah êh-mêtawêcik . Then at one time, when they had been there for quite a while, as they went to the river to drink, they played about there, casting pebbles into the water, to amuse themselves.
kîtahtawê kâ-wâpamâcik awiya natimihk êh-pê-mâhâpwêwêyit , ôsihk êh-pimiskâyit . Presently they saw someone coming downstream, paddling a canoe.
nimisê , awîna nâha ? itwêw aw osîmimâw . “Sister, who is that?” cried the younger one.

êh-itâpit aw ômisimâw ,
hê , nisîm , miyâmay nâpêw ! itwêw aw ômisimâw ; When the elder sister looked over there, “Why, sister, surely, a man!” said the elder sister;

nisîmis ,
nâpêw wâpamâyêko , wîkimâhkêk , mâskôc êkâ wîh-nipahâhkatosoyêko , kikîh-itikonâw kikâwiyinaw , itêw ôsîma . “Little sister, ‘If you see a man, marry him, and perhaps you will not starve to death,’ our mother said to us,” she told her younger sister.
piyisk kisiwâk êh-pê-ihtâyit , kâ-nisitawêyimâcik nâpêwa . At last, when he had come near, they knew him for a man.

ômis îtwêw aw omisimâw :
âstam ! pê-nâtahonân ; The elder sister called, “Come here! Come fetch us in your canoe;
ahpôh ka-wîkimitinân , itêw aw ômisimâw . if you like, we will marry you,” she called to him.
tâpiskôc êkâ êh-pêhtahk awa sihkihp ês âwa . Exactly as if he did not hear it that Hell-Diver acted, for he it must have been.
êkotê iskwêwah k-âyâyit isi sihkôw , kâ-wâpamâcik mîkisah êh-sihkôyit . He spat in the direction of the women, and they saw that he spat wampum-beads.
nyâ , nisîmis , êkw ês âwa mikisiyiniw ! itêwak . “Goodness, little sister, this must be the Wampum-Man!” said one to the other.

kîtahtawê ,
mîkisiyiniw ! itêw . Presently, “Wampum-Man!” she called to him.

ômis îtwêw sihkihp , tâpiskôc êkwêyâk êh-pêhtahk ,
mâh ! tânis êtwêyêk ? Thus spoke Hell-Diver, as though only now he heard, “Why! what is that you say?”

seg.gloss: “Come here, Wampum-Man! Come fetch us in your canoe.
If you like we will marry you, is what we said.”

p.seg: êhag , cêskwah ! itwêw awa sihkihp . “Yes, just a moment!” said Hell-Diver.
êkotê isi kapâw . He landed there.
miyosiyiwa ôh ôskinîkiskwêwa . Those young women were handsome.
êkwah pôsihêw , pisisik ê-sihkot ; mîkisah mâna nipîhk êh-pahkisiniyit . So he took them on board, spitting all the time, and each time wampum-beads fell into the water.
êkosi kîwêhtahêw . So he started to take them home.
kîtahtawê kâ-wâpamâcik mostoswah . Presently they saw some buffalo.

seg.gloss: “Goodness, you ought to take this chance to kill something!

p.seg: êh-nôhtêhkatêyâhk ôma ! itwêyiwa . The fact is, we are hungry!” they said.

seg.gloss: “Yes, yes, my wives! I shall kill some; you shall eat.”

p.seg:
êkwah êh-kapât ,
hâw , nîwitik , kanawêyihtamok ôma kitôsinaw , itêw . Then, when his wives went ashore, “Now, wives, do you keep watch over our boat here,” he told them.
tâpwê ati-sipwêhtêw , ê-wîh-minahot . So he went off to kill game.
êh-kitâpamâcik ôk ôskinîkiskwêwak , tâpwê pâskiswêyiwa ; pêyak nipahêyiwa . As those young women observed him, he shot at the animals; he killed one.
miywêyihtamok . They were glad.

seg.gloss: “So now we shall eat!

p.seg: knôhtêhkatâhtânaw , nisîmis ! itwêw awa omisimâw . We surely were hungry, little sister!” said the elder.

tâpwê êh-pê-sâkêwêt awa sihkihp ,
nîwitik , kika-mîcisonâwâw ; niminahon , itêw . And so, when that Hell-Diver came back down the bank, “Wives, you shall eat; I have killed some game,” he told them.
êkosi sakahpitamok ôm ôsi , êh-âmaciwêcik . Accordingly, they tied fast the canoe and climbed up the bank.
wâpamêwak mostoswah itah êh-pimisiniyit . They saw the buffalo lying there.

êh-takohtêcik ,
haw , nîwitik , kakwêyâhok mihtah êh-otinamêk . When they got there, “Now then, wives, work as fast as you can, gathering faggots.

seg.gloss: In the meantime I shall skin it and cut it up, so that you can make the fire and do the roasting.

p.seg: kinôhtêhkatâhtâwâw ! itêw . You said you were hungry!” he told them.
tâpwê kiyipîwak êh-kotawêcik . So they were quick about making the fire.

seg.gloss: “I am in a hurry, wives.

p.seg: ôtêh ômah êh-wîkihk , mistah ê-wih-miyawâtikwahk , ê-wih-nîmihitohk , nipêhikawinâtokê , êkâ mayaw ê-ntawi-takosiniyân , itêw . Over yonder in the camp there is going to be a big celebration and a dance, so they must be waiting for me, seeing that I am not getting back in time,” he told them.

êkwah ôki oskinîkiskwêwak k-ôtinahkik mihtah ,
nâ , nisîmis , kêhcinâh awa êh-kîhcêyihtâkosit kinâpêminaw ! itêw . Then, as the young women were picking up sticks, “Goodness, little sister, surely our husband is an important man!” she said to her.
nâh ! itwêw awa osîmimâw ; “Pshaw!” answered the younger one;

seg.q: nimisê , niya wiya êh-itêyimak , tâpiskôc êh-môhcôwit !
seg.gloss: “Sister, as for me, he seems to me just as if he were crazy!
He talks too silly.”

seg.q: nâh , pasinaw cî ntawêyimâw itê ê-wîh-nîmihitôwiht ?
seg.gloss: “Why, do you suppose he would be in demand, then, for a dance?
Certainly, he is Wampum-Man.”

seg.q: niwâpamâw ana kîmôc mâna êh-otinât mîkisisah , êh-saskamot .
seg.gloss: “I saw the creature taking beads, on the sly, and sticking them into his mouth.

seg.q:
êkotah mâna ,
nikitâpamikwak , êtêyihtahkih , kâ-sihkot , mîkisah mâna kâ-sihkwâtât .
seg.gloss: Then, whenever he thinks we are looking at him, he spits, and that is the way he always spits out beads.

p.seg:
namoy ân êwakô , itêw ,
mikisiyiniw , itwêw aw ôsîmimâw . He is no Wampum-Man, not he,” said the younger sister.
êkosi êkwah êkwah ê-kotawêcik , kêkac kîsi-wiyanihêw awa sihkihp . So then, when they made the fire, Hell-Diver had almost finished preparing the carcass.
êh-kîsi-kotawêcik , itohtêwak . When they had built the fire, they went to where he was.

êkwah ,
ahaw , nîwitik , itah êh-miywâsik wiyâs otinamok , ta-nawaciyêk , itêw . Then, “Now, wives, take the best parts of the meat to roast,” he told them.
tâpwê skwêwak ôki otinamwak wiyâs . Accordingly the woman took the meat.
êkoyikohk kâ-pakocênât awa , wâpahtam awa osîmimâw wiyin . When he had opened the belly, there the younger sister saw some fat.
nê , wîsi niya nik-âyân , t-aspahcikêyân ! itwêw . “Ooh, me, let me have the belly-fat, to eat with my meat!” she cried.

yôhô ! itwêw awa sihkihp ,
kêkway mâka kiy-ôtakohpiyân ôma kâ-wîh-mâh-mancôkâhk ? itwêw . “Hoho!” cried Hell-Diver, “And what am I then to have for my blanket-robe at the Spirit Dance?” he said.

omisimâw awa ,
niya wiya wîkwah nka-manaspahcikanân ! itwêw . The elder sister cried, “And I, I shall take the kidney-fat to eat as a titbit with my meat!”
yaw , kêkway mâka kiy-ôwîkohkêyân ? itwêw . “Oho, and what I am I to do for kidney-fat? he cried. [sic]
ncawâc otastotiniyiw wîsi . His headgear, for want of better, was belly-fat.
yôhô , kêkway mâka kiy-ôtastotiniyân ôma ka-wîh-mâ-mancôkâhk ? itwêw awa sihkihp . “Hoho, and what would I have for my head-dress at the Spirit Dance?” cried Hell-Diver.

êkoh ôki oskinîkiskwêwak ômisih itwêw aw osîmimâw :
nimisê , kêhcin âwa êh-môhcôwit ! itwêw . Then of those young women, the younger said, “Sister, certainly he is crazy!”

seg.q: nâh ! êh-okimâwit awa , k-ôh-ntomiht itê nânitaw ê-wih-isistâwiht .
seg.gloss: “Nonsense! Because he is a chieftain is why he is called wherever there is to be a ceremony of any kind.”

seg.q: a , pêyakoh-kihcêyimêw awa ! êh-môhcôwit niya wiya nitêyimâw !
seg.gloss: “Hee, this person is alone in looking up to him! As for me, I think he is crazy!”

p.seg: êkây êkos îsi ! kika-pêhtâk , itêw osîma . “Don't. He will hear you,” she told her younger sister.
êkoyikohk kîsitêpowak . By this time they had finished their cooking.
pê-mîcisw êkwa ! ât êh-itikot , tâpiskôc êkâ êh-pêhtawât . Although they called to him, “Come eat!” it was just as if he had not heard.

seg.gloss: “Dear me, it is you I am calling, Wampum-Man!”

p.seg: hâ ! êkoyikohk ! itêw sihkihp . “Hah! At last!” Hell-Diver answered her.

seg.gloss: “Come and eat now!”

p.seg: tâpwê ntawih-mîcisôw . So he went to eat.

seg.gloss: “Now wives, eat in a hurry.

seg.q: mistah êtok ôma nôtamihtâson , ôm îtê k-ôh-ntomikawiyân , ka-wîh-nîmihitohk .
seg.gloss: I am delaying pretty badly with all this, seeing that I am being called over there for the dance.”

p.seg: tâpwê kiyipa kîsi-mîcisôwak . And so they quickly finished their meal.
ê-kîsi-mîcisocik , êkwah pôsihtâwak wiyâsah , ê-sipwêhtêcik . When they had done eating, they put their meat on board the canoe, and went on.

kîtahtawê êh-atiy-otâkosiniyik , êkotah oma mâna ,
ôma kâ-nêyâk kâ-nîmihitohk , k-êtwêt ; Presently, as it was going towards evening, every little ways he would say, “Just at that next point is the dance,”
mâka nam âwiya wâpamêwak . but they saw no one.
êhê hehe ! itwêw awa sihkihp ; “Well, well, well!” said Hell-Diver;

seg.q: wâhyaw êcik âni êtokê kâ-mâwacihitoh mâna .
seg.gloss: “It surely does seem that they have taken a far-off place for the council.

p.seg: âta wiya ohcita piko ta-pêhikawiyân , kîspin êkâ itah êyâyâni , namoya môcikihtâwak , itêw . “Only, of course, they will be sure to wait for me, seeing that if I am not there, they never have any sport,” he told them.
cîkih êh-ihtâcik , kâ-pê-sâkêwêyit ayîsiyiniwah . When they had got near, someone came into view.
îh pêyak kâ-pê-sâkêwêt ! itwêyiwa . “Over there is someone coming into view!” cried one.

seg.q: nâ , êkotah êtok ôma kây-itahk kinâpêminaw !
seg.gloss: “Dear me, I suppose this is the place our husband meant!

p.seg: êkwah kê-miywêyihtamahk , wâpamâyahkwâwi ayîsiyiniwak , itêw osîma aw îskwêw . Now we shall be glad, when we see some people,” the woman said to her younger sister.

ômis îtwêyiwa :
hêhwah , takosin sihkihp ! kâ-matwêh-twêwiht . They heard that person cry, “Yoho, Hell-Diver has come!”
pôtih mihcêt pê-sâkêwêyiwa iskwêwa . Then a great many women came into view.
nêêh , sihkihp pêtahiskwêwêw ! itâw . “Goodness me, Hell-Diver is bringing women in his canoe!” was said of him.

yah , nîwitik , nêhâ anih k-êtâcik ,
sihkihp , k-êtwêcik , itêw . “Yes, wives, it is that person over yonder they mean, when they say ‘Hell-Diver,’” he told them.

seg.gloss: “Hell-Diver, come, land!”

p.seg: âhci pikoh pimicimêw . He kept right on paddling.

kîtahtawê kâ-pêhtahkik ôk iskwêwak ,
kinêpêmâwâw sihkihp !
mîkisiyiniw , itihk ! Presently those wives heard, “You are embarrassing Hell-Diver by the way you address him! Call him Wampum-Man!” LB's footnote on {kinêpêmâwâw}: Thus the record here and below; the usual form is {nêpêwimêw}: “he shames him by speech”.

seg.gloss: “Wampum-Man is bringing women in his canoe! Come to shore!”

p.seg: hah , niyâ k-êtikawiyân , nîwitik ! itêw , êh-kapât . “Ha, it is to me they are talking, wives!” he told them, and went to the bank.

seg.gloss: “You deprived yourself of much pleasure, coming late.

p.seg: êkos âni êkwah kî-nîmihitohk , itimâwa onâpêmiwâwa . The dancing has gone on without you,” their husband was told.

kîtahtawê kâ-pê-takohtêyit nîso oskinîkiskwêwah , osîma sihkihp ,
hêêy ! k-êtwêyit ; Presently there came two young women, Hell-Diver's sisters, and, “Hey!” they said;
kicâhkosinawak êh-pêsihcik ! êh-itwêyit . “Sisters-in-law have been brought to us!”
êh-itâpicik , awîn ôhi , kîh-câh-cîpikocêsiyiwa , êh-tâpihcêpisôyit atimo-mêya êh-pâstêyik . When they looked there, why, they were sharp-nosed little things, [no translation]
êkosi wîcôhkamawâwak , owiyâsimiwâwa êh-tahkohtaciwêhtatâwiht owiyâsimiwâwa . So then they were aided in the task of carrying their meat up the high bank of the stream.

êkosi an êkwa kê-mânokêhk itah kâ-wîh-nîmihitohk , k-êtwêwiht , êkosi wiyawâw mîna mânokêwak ôk ôskinîkiskwêwak , sihkihp awa wîwa . “They are putting up the tipis by the dancing-place,” the people said; so those young women, too, Hell-Diver's wives, set up their tent.
ê-kîsi-mânokêwiht wîkiwâw , êkwah êh-mîcisocik , âsay kâ-pê-ntomiht . When their tent was set up, and they were eating, already he was summoned.
sihkihp , êkwah kintomikawin , itâw . “Hell-Diver, you are being called,” he was told.
tâpiskôc êkâ êh-pêhtahk . t was just as if he had not heard.
êkosi kîwêyiwa kâ-pê-ntomikot . Soon the one who had come to call him went back.
piyisk kôtawi-pêhâw . At last they grew impatient waiting for him.

seg.q: yô , tânsi êtat , êkâ mayaw kâ-pê-tohtêt sihkihp ?
seg.gloss: “Hoho, what did you say to Hell-Diver, that he is so long about coming?”
“‘You are summoned to come at once,’ I said to him.”
“Aha, no doubt you embarrassed him with your speech!
‘Wampum-Man, your fellow-Wampum-Man summons you,’ go say to him.”
“Very well.”
“Wampum-Man!”
“What is it?”
“‘He is to come right away,’ your fellow-Wampum-Man says to you.”

p.seg: ahag , itwêw awa sihkihp . “Very well,” said Hell-Diver.

seg.gloss: “Now them, wives, bring a big dish.

seg.q: mistah âni mâna nitasamikawin itah êh-miywâsik kîsitêw .
seg.gloss: You see, I am always given a big share of the best hot food.”

p.seg: êkwah wawêyîw . Then he put on his finery.

seg.gloss: “Here, Aînée, bring the belly-fat!”

p.seg: miyêw . She gave it to him.
êyakw akwanahôw . This them he wrapped round himself as a robe.
wiyin êkwah pakwahtêhôw . And a piece of fatty meat he used for a belt.

seg.gloss: “Bring that fat!”
seg.note: LB on {wîyinoh}: If correctly recorded, for {wiyinwah}: (plural) “pieces of fat meat,” but the particle {anima}: “that” is singular number.

p.seg: itisinamawêw , êkwah êwakonih êh-pah-pîmoyit âyîtaw . She handed it to him, and this he twisted round him at both sides.
êkwah mîna otastotiniw , wîsi ê-postastotinêt . Then he put on his head-dress; belly-fat he wore as his head-dress.

êkosi êkwah ê-wih-ati-wayawît ,
ahâw , nîwitik , êkâya pê-ntawâpahkêk mêyâkwâm . So then, as he was about to go out of the lodge, “Now, my wives, be sure not to come and look on.
misawâc nka-pêtân ta-mîciyêk pêtonawân , itêw wîwa ; Have no fear, I shall bring you some of the ceremonial food to eat,” he told his wives;

seg.gloss: “Be sure, however, not to come and look on.

p.seg: misawâc nka-kiskêyihtên , pêy-itohtêyêko , itêw . I shall know it without fail, if you come there,” he told them.
êkos âspin êh-itohtêt . So off he went.
mihtâtamwak ôk îskwêwak , ê-kih-nôhtêh-kitâpahkêcik . Those women were disappointed, for they were eager to look on.

ômis îtwêw aw ôsîmimâw :
nimisê , nama ciw ôyâ êh-pîwêyihtâkosit ? Then the younger one said: “Sister, cannot it be that that person who has just gone is held in contempt?

seg.gloss: It surely seems that he is crazy!”

p.seg: nâh ! itwêw aw ômisimâw ; “Nonsense!” said the elder sister;

seg.q: pasinâw cî mistahi ntawêyihtâkosiw , ôma nântaw k-êsistâwiht ?
seg.gloss: “In that case, could it be that he is so greatly in demand at whatever ceremony his people are having?

p.seg: êh-okimâwit êtokw ôyâ ! itwêw aw ômisimâw . No doubt that man is a chief!” said the elder sister.

namoya ! itwêw aw osîmimâw ;
okimâwit ana , namoya tah-akwanahôw wîsih . “No!” said the younger; “A man who is a chief will not put on a blanket-robe of belly-fat.”
nâh , tahki pikw âwa êh-pîwêyimât ! itêw osîma . “Yah, this girl is always belittling him!” she said of her sister.
cikêmô nama nipîwêyimâw , ê-ma-môhcôwit ! itêw . “And I suppose I should not think little of him, when he is entirely daft!” she answered her.
kîtahtawê kâ-pêhtahk êh-matwê-sâkôwêwiht , ê-nîmihitôwiht . Presently she heard the whooping, as the people danced.

seg.gloss: “Sister, I am going to look on!”

p.seg: êkâ wiya ! itêw osîma ; “Do not!” she said to her younger sister;

seg.gloss: “We shall get him angry.
I have no doubt that she has supernatural power, the way he is esteemed.”

p.seg: pasinaw cî kihcêyihtâkosit , wiyinwa akwanahôw ? itêw . “Is it likely that one who is held in esteem would wear pieces of fat for his blanket-robe?” she asked her.

seg.gloss: “She is always belittling him, this girl, and no one else!”

seg.q: nah , kiya mâka piko kâ-kihcêyimat wiyâ môhcôyiniwit !
seg.gloss: “Bosh, it is only you who hold him in esteem that crazy-man!
Please let me go look on, big sister.”
“Very well.
Just for a short while.
You will see what he does to us, if he sees you!”
“Well, I shall try not to let him see me.”

p.seg: tâpwê ntawâpahkêw . Accordingly, she went and looked on.

êh-paspâpit , kâ-wâpamât ôhih onâpêmiwâwa êh-tah-tahkiskâmiht ,
sihkihp ayôtôcikâniwiw ! êh-itwêwiht , When she peeped in through the door, why, there she saw her husband being kicked about, while the people cried, “They are having a lot of fun with Hell-Diver!”

ostikwânisiyiw piko ê-sâkamôyik , asiskiy misiwê êh-ayâyik , ôma wiyin k-âkwanahoyit mitonê ê-mêstiskamoht . and there was only his little head sticking out, for he was all covered with dirt, and the fat he wore as a blanket was all trodden to bits.
wâwîs êkwah pîwêyimêw . She despised him more than ever.

kâ-wâpamât awa sihkihp owîkimâkana ê-paspâpiyit , kâ-pasikosipahtât awa sihkihp , nôtokêsiwa êkotah êh-apiyit , êôkonih êh-tah-tahkiskawât awa sihkihp ,
sihkihp âyôtôcikâniwiw ! When Hell-Diver saw his wife peeping in, up he jumped to his feet, and an old woman who sat there, her he kicked and kicked, crying, “They are having a lot of fun with Hell-Diver!”

êh-itwêt ,
nââh , kitimahêw sihkihp nôtokêsiwah ! êh-itwêwiht . whereupon, “Heavens, Hell-Diver is abusing an old woman!” the people said of him.
kîwêpahtâw aw oskinîkiskwêw . That young wife ran home.

ômis îtwêw :
nimisê , mistah ês ôyâ êh-pîwiyiniwit kinâpêminaw kâ-kihcêyimat ! She said, “Sister, that husband of ours must be indeed of small account, he whom you admire so!

seg.gloss: Come, let us be off!

p.seg: niya wiya nipakwâtâw , êh-môhcôwit , itêw . As for me, I hate the crazy fool,” she said to the other.

seg.q: nâ , êh-manitôwit êtokw âna ! ka-nipahikonaw ana !
seg.gloss: “Goodness, I am sure he has manitou power! He will kill us!”

seg.q: pasinaw cî tah-tahkiskawâw manitôwit anah ? namoya êksi tah-tôtawâw .
seg.gloss: “Is it likely he would be kicked about, if he had manitou power? He would not be treated that way.

p.seg: êh-môhcôwit anah , k-ôh-mêtawâkêhk , itêw . Because he is crazy, they use him as a butt,” she told the other.

seg.gloss: “But how can we do it?”

p.seg: mistikwak nîso nk-ôtinâwak , itêw aw ôsîmimâw . “I shall take two tree-trunks,” said the younger sister.
êhag , itêw . “Yes,” she answered.
tâpwê nâtêw ôhi mistikwah , êh-iskosicik , iyikohk êh-iskosihât ôhi mistikwah . Accordingly, she went and got those trees and chopped them to the length of those women.
itah êh-pimisihk aw oskinîkiskwêw , êkotah ahêw ôhi mistikwah . In the place where she was to lie, the young woman laid the one tree-trunk.

seg.gloss: “Now then, there are to be many bees here! -
When he uncovers you, that Hell-Diver, assail him in full number, and fight him!

p.seg: êkosi ! - êkwah kiya ! itêw omisah . There! Now, you!” she said to her elder sister.
êkotah mîna ahêw mistikwah , êh-akwanahât . Over there, too, she placed a tree-trunk, and pulled the coverlets over it.
hâw , ôtah ta-mihcêtiwak mantôsak ! itêw . “Now then, here shall be many bugs!” she said to it.

êkos êh-isi-akwanahât ,
wîh-kawisimocih ôtah , tahkwamahkêk , mancôsitik ! itêw . Then, when she thus covered them, “When he lies down here, bit him, bugs!” she told them.
ha , nyâ , nimisê ! tapasîtân ! itêw . “Now, come, sister! Let us flee!” she said to her.
tapasîwak . They fled.
êkwah iyikohk kêkâc êh-wâpaniyik , pôyôwân , êkwah êh-kîwêt sihkihp . Then, when it was almost daybreak, the dancing stopped, and Hell-Diver went home.
tâpwê pêtâw ôm îtah êh-miywâsiniyik wîhkôhtôwin . He really did bring some of the good food from the feast.

seg.gloss: “Here, wives, is the ceremonial meal!”

p.seg: namoya kitotik . They said nothing to him.
wâctakâc ôki kâ-pôsâhkwâmicik ! itwêw . “A nine days' wonder, what sound sleepers they are!” he said.
êkosi nahastâw , êkwah êh-nahapit , êh-kêtayôwinisêt , ê-wih-kawisimot . [no translation]
ôh ômisimâwa kawisimototawêw . [no translation]
mayaw êh-kîsi-akwanahot , sêmâk tahkwamik mantôsah . [no translation]

yâ , êkâ wiyah , omihcim ! kiyâm ôma kih-mâ-mancôkâniwiw , itêw , êh-kisiwâsit ,
êh-nîmihitôwiht , êh-wîcihiwêwak ! êh-itêyihtahk , owîkimâkanah . [no translation]
tahkih êh-tahkwamikot mancôsah , piyis wanskâw . [no translation]
wâctakâh kâ-kâhkwêyihtaskit ! itêw ; [no translation]
maht ôsîmim ! itwêw , êkotêh mîna êh-kawisimot . [no translation]
âsay mîna âmôwah tah-tahkwamik . [no translation]

êkâ wiya , osîmim ! niwîh-nipân ; ninêstosin , êyikohk êh-nîmihitoyân ! ta-kih-nêstosit , êh-kih-tah-tahkiskâht mitonih ! [no translation]
namoy êcik anih ta-kîh-nahi-wîcihiwêyân itah êh-nîmihitohk , iyikohk kâ-kâhkwêyihtaskiyêk ! itwêw . [no translation]
ncawâc ôtah kont îtah kawisimôw . So he needs lay down somewhere or other.
êyikohk êh-âkwâ-kîsikâyik , êkoyikohk pêkopayiw . It was broad daylight, when he awoke.
êh-ôhpiskwêyit , kêyâpic nipâyiwa owîkimâkana . When he raised his head, his wives were still sleeping.
waniskâh , omihcim ! âkwâ-kîsikâw ! itwêw . “Get up, Aînée! It is broad day!” he said.
namoya waniskâyiwa . She did not get up.

seg.gloss: “You, at least, Cadette!”

p.seg: êkâ h-waniskâyit , wiya waniskâw . When she did not get up, he got up himself.

ôh ôsîmimâwa êh-pâskiwêpinât , kahkiyaw âmôwah ohpiyâyiwa , êh-mâmâwôhkâkot , pikw îtah êh-tahkwamikot , piyis misiwê ohkwâkanihk , mîna ositihk ohi mancôsah êh-tâh-tahkwamikot . When he threw back the younger one's covers, all the bees flew up, and the whole swarm went for him and stung him here and there, until his face was all covered, and meanwhile those bugs kept biting his feet.
piyisk wayawîyâmôw , apisîs êh-tôhkâpit , âmôwah êh-tôtâkot . At last he ran out of the tipi, with his eyes barely a little open, what with the way the bees had treated him.
wiyah nipîhk itohtêw sîpîhk , êh-kîh-otinahk mihkoh . As for him, he went to the water, to the river, taking with him some blood.
êkosi pôsiw , êh-ati-nikamot . Then he embarked, singing the while.
nama ci wiya êh-nipahât owîkimâkanah , ê-wîh-nipahisot ? itâw . “Is he not perhaps, having killed his wives, about to kill himself?” they said of him.

môhkomân êh-otinahk ,
êy , wîh-tahkamisôw ! itâw . When he drew his knife, “Hey, he is going to stab himself!” they said of him.

tâpwê tahkahtam ôma mihkoh , kontah ê-sîkipayiyik mihkoh ,
nipahisôw ! êh-itiht . And really, he stabbed the vessel full of blood, and, when the blood spurted all over, “He is killing himself!” they said of him.
êkosi kwatapîw , êkotê sîpâ êh-pimih-micimît ôsihk . Then he tipped his canoe and got under it, holding to it as it drifted along.

seg.gloss: “Hey, Hell-Diver has killed himself! His canoe has tipped!”

p.seg: êkos ê-sipwêyâhokot . [no translation]

tâpwê kîsinâcihêw owîkimâkanah ! kakwê-otinihk ! itwêwân , ôsihk êh-nâtahoht . Then, as he was carried away by the current, “Truly he is bringing grief on his wives! Try to get hold of him!” was said of him, and they went to fetch him in a canoe.
otôsih ôma otinamwân ; namoya êkotah ayâw , êh-kôkît . They got hold of his canoe; he was not in it, for he had dived.
tâpw ês âni êh-nipahisot ! itâw . “It seems that he has really killed himself!” they said of him.
wâhyaw êkotê kapâw , kotak ê-sâkahikanisiwiyik êkotêh êh-itohtêt . Far from there he went to shore, having reached a little lake.
kîtahtawê êkotê kâ-matwê-nikamot , Presently they heard him singing in yonder place.

seg.gloss: “So he is trying to fool us, is Hell-Diver!
Over there he is singing!
You will have to get into the water;

p.seg: miskawâyêko , nipahâhkêk kâ-kîsinâcihât wîwah ! êh-itiht . if you find him, kill him; he is bringing grief upon his wives!” was said to him.

êkwah misiwê êh-ntonâht nipîhk , piyisk kêkway miskoskahkwâwih , kîtahtawê êh-tah-tahkiskahkik , kîtahtawê tâpiskôc êh-matwêwêyik êh-itihtahkik , Then, when they sought him everywhere in the water, at last, when they felt something underfoot, and gave it a few kicks, then they heard something go off like a gun.

okâwiyah ês ôhi êh-pâskatayêskâmiht ; êkosi kinipahânaw ! êh-itwêyit ôh ayîsiyiniwah . “They have stepped on his mother's belly and it has burst with a bang; so now we have killed him!” said those people.
pônihik . They left him alone.
ha , êkoyikohk êskwâk âtayôhkêwin . Well, that is the end of the sacred story.
